definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: Rajin-Sonbong (or Rason, for short) lies by the Sea of Japan in the country’s north-east, near the border with Russia.
sentences.chinese: 罗津靠近日本海，在北韩的东北部，接近俄国边界。

sentences.english: But the fact is, they are completely wiped out by the Japanese Navy within less than one month.
sentences.chinese: 但结果呢，他们不到一个月就被日本海军给消灭了。

sentences.english: Jppan Sea is a vast marginal sea and is surrounded by continental shelf.
sentences.chinese: 日本海是一个广阔的边缘海，四周被大陆架所围。

sentences.english: The navy's biggest vessels currently are a pair of smaller helicopter carriers.
sentences.chinese: 日本海军目前最大的军舰是两艘较小的直升机航母。

sentences.english: Japan’s armed forces were present as observers during the Sea of Japan war games.
sentences.chinese: 日本军队在日本海演习过程中作为观察员在场。

sentences.english: For the first time, the Japanese Navy had been defeated.
sentences.chinese: 这是第一次，日本海军被击败。

sentences.english: Our hotel commands a magnificent view of the boundless Japan Sea.
sentences.chinese: 面临日本海，可眺望海景的酒店。

sentences.english: In 1941, the Japanese Navy commandeered it.
Japan's Maritime Self Defense Force has dispatched a destroyer and helicopters.
sentences.chinese: 日本海军自卫队排出了一艘驱逐舰和数个直升机。

sentences.english: And Warship Zhenyuan was wounded after striking a reef and it finally surrendered and put into Japanese Navy.
sentences.chinese: 而镇远则因触礁受损，最后投降编入日本海军。

definition: Tsushima Strait, between Japan and South Korea
Korea Strait/Tsushima Strait (between Japan and Korea)
Kuril Islands, archipelago in Sakhalin, far-eastern Russia
Aleutian Islands (trailing 2250 km southwest of Alaska almost down to Kamtchatka)
Bashi Channel in the northern part of the Luzon Strait, just south of Taiwan
Ryukyu Islands/Okinawa 沖繩|冲绳[Chong1 sheng2] and other islands of modern Japan
